title: How old are juniors in high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: In USA, high school juniors are 11th grade In US, most states require turning 5 sometime between July and October to enter kindergarten. If you started school as soon as old enough too, and did not repeat any grade levels, then you should 16 on the first day of the school year and turning 17 during that school year or the following summer. As a rule of thumb, in most cases, if starting on-time and never repeated a grade, your grade level should be your age at when the school year starts plus five. 11th grade: 16 (11+5=16), 6th grade: 11 (6+5=11). Age=Grade+5. Grade=Age-5. For those with September birthdays in schools that allow entry into kindergarten with the 5th birthday as late as September 30 or October 1 and thus starting kindergarten while still 4, then your your grade level should be your age at when the school year starts plus four (start junior year at 15, finish 16). Age=Grade+4. Grade=Age-4. A significant minority of summer birthdays (Jun-Sep) start a year late or fail a grade.

High School Juniors: A school year in North America usually begins in early September of one year and ends in mid June of the next. Current high school juniors in the United States were born between September 1, 2003 and August 31, 2004. This means that the oldest students began the grade as newly minted 17-year-olds, and will finish junior year when they’re almost 18. The youngest students would have just turned 16 at the start of junior year, and will still be 16 when they finish. College Juniors: Current college juniors in the United States were born between September 1, 1999 and August 31, 2000. This means that the oldest students began as newly minted 21-year-olds, and will finish junuor year when they’re almost 22. The youngest students would have just turned 20 at the start of junior year, and will still be 20 when they finish.
